H0.text: If the frequency remains constant, the wavelength increases is the best description of the relationship between frequency and wavelength of electromagnetic waves.

H1.text: The wavelength decreases as the frequency decreases is the best description of the relationship between frequency and wavelength of electromagnetic waves.

H2.text: The frequency increases as the wavelength decreases is the best description of the relationship between frequency and wavelength of electromagnetic waves.

H3.text: If the wavelength remains constant, the frequency increases is the best description of the relationship between frequency and wavelength of electromagnetic waves.

A4.text: Frequency is inversely proportional to wavelength, according to the equation: v = fÎ»

A5.text: Lower frequencies have longer wavelengths, and higher frequencies have shorter wavelengths
